verses.kjv: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph: and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.web: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph came near. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.ct: The daughters of Zelophehad came forward. Zelophehad was the son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh — from the clan of Manasseh son of Joseph. His daughters' names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
verses.web: They stood before Moses, before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, at the door of the Tent of Meeting, saying,
verses.ct: They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and the entire community at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and said,

verses.kjv: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered themselves together against the LORD in the company of Korah; but died in his own sin, and had no sons.
verses.web: “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against LORD in the company of Korah, but he died in his own sin. He had no sons.
verses.ct: "Our father died in the wilderness. He wasn't part of the group that rebelled against the LORD with Korah — he died for his own sin. But he had no sons.

verses.kjv: Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us therefore a possession among the brethren of our father.
verses.web: Why should the name of our father be taken away from among his family, because he had no son? Give to us a possession among the brothers of our father.”
verses.ct: Why should our father's name disappear from his family just because he had no son? Give us land among our father's relatives."

verses.kjv: And Moses brought their cause before the LORD.
verses.web: Moses brought their cause before LORD.
verses.ct: Moses brought their case before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.kjv: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
verses.web: “The daughters of Zelophehad speak right. You shall surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brothers. You shall cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.
verses.ct: "The daughters of Zelophehad are right. You must give them an inheritance of land among their father's relatives. Transfer their father's inheritance to them.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
verses.web: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘If a man dies, and has no son, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass to his daughter.
verses.ct: Tell the people of Israel: 'If a man dies without a son, his inheritance passes to his daughter.

verses.kjv: And if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
verses.web: If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
verses.ct: If he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.

verses.kjv: And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father’s brethren.
verses.web: If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
verses.ct: If he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father's brothers.

verses.kjv: And if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: If his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his kinsman who is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it. This shall be a statute and ordinance for the children of Israel, as LORD commanded Moses.’ ”
verses.ct: If his father has no brothers, give his inheritance to the nearest relative in his clan, and that person will take possession of it.' This will be a permanent legal rule for the people of Israel, just as the LORD commanded Moses."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Get thee up into this mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Go up into this mountain of Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Go up this mountain of Abarim and look out over the land I have given to the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.
verses.web: When you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was gathered;
verses.ct: After you have seen it, you too will die and join your people, just as your brother Aaron did.

verses.kjv: For ye rebelled against my commandment in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me at the water before their eyes: that is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.web: because in the strife of the congregation, you rebelled against my word in the wilderness of Zin, to honor me as holy at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
verses.ct: This is because you both rebelled against my command in the wilderness of Zin when the community quarreled with me. You failed to honor me as holy before their eyes at the waters." These are the waters of Meribah in Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin.

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto the LORD, saying,
verses.web: Moses spoke to LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD,

verses.kjv: Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
verses.web: “Let LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation,
verses.ct: "LORD, the God who gives breath to every living thing, please appoint someone to lead this community —

verses.kjv: Which may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the LORD be not as sheep which have no shepherd.
verses.web: who may go out before them, and who may come in before them, and who may lead them out, and who may bring them in, that the congregation of LORD may not be as sheep which have no shepherd.”
verses.ct: someone who will lead them out and bring them back, who will guide them in everything they do, so the LORD's people won't be like sheep without a shepherd."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Take Joshua son of Nun, a man who has the Spirit in him, and lay your hand on him.

verses.kjv: And set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
verses.web: Set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and commission him in their sight.
verses.ct: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and the entire community, and commission him in front of everyone.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put some of thine honour upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.
verses.web: You shall give authority to him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may obey.
verses.ct: Give him some of your authority so that the whole community of Israel will follow his leadership.

verses.kjv: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall ask counsel for him after the judgment of Urim before the LORD: at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.
verses.web: He shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before LORD. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.”
verses.ct: He will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will seek the LORD's guidance for him through the Urim. At Eleazar's word, Joshua and all the people of Israel — the entire community — will go out, and at his word they will come back."

verses.kjv: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him: and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:
verses.web: Moses did as LORD commanded him. He took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation.
verses.ct: Moses did exactly what the LORD commanded. He brought Joshua before Eleazar the priest and the whole community.

verses.kjv: And he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: He laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as LORD spoke by Moses.
verses.ct: He laid his hands on him and commissioned him, just as the LORD had instructed through Moses.
